thread.title: One Falcons player sensed the Tom Brady comeback
thread.title_full: One Falcons player sensed the Tom Brady comeback

title: One Falcons player sensed the Tom Brady comeback
text:
Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email One Falcons player sensed the Tom Brady comeback He tried to warn them. Post to Facebook One Falcons player sensed the Tom Brady comeback He tried to warn them. Check out this story on USATODAY.com: http://ftw.usatoday.com/2017/02/falcons-player-taylor-gabriel-micd-up-warned-tom-brady-super-bowl-comeback-video-nfl/ Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs One Falcons player sensed the Tom Brady comeback Andrew Joseph 10:13 p.m. ET Feb. 8, 2017 
Screenshot (Photo: Twitter) 
Falcons fans will not want to watch this video. Really, you've been warned. 
As the Atlanta Falcons were up 21-0 in the first half of Super Bowl 51 against the Patriots, confidence was riding high on the Atlanta sidelines. But Taylor Gabriel knew it wouldn't be that easy. He just knew, and he tried to warn his teammates. 
In a mic'd up conversation with wide receiver Mohamed Sanu, Gabriel, who is awesome , could be heard trying to settle down an overconfident Sanu. Falcons up 21-0"We bout to put up 40 on they ass""Man.... we got to" pic.twitter.com/OP1d7HRRKw 
"It's Tom Brady though," Gabriel said despite the massive lead. He knew Atlanta would couldn't relax. He knew that Tom Brady is … Tom Brady . He tried to warn them! He really did. 
But Sanu's response was emblematic of the entire meltdown for the Falcons. 
"We're about to put up 40-something on their ass … They've never seen anything like this," he said. 
They should have listened. Read or Share this story: http://ftw.usatoday.com/2017/02/falcons-player-taylor-gabriel-micd-up-warned-tom-brady-super-bowl-comeback-video-nfl/ Most Popular
